hypothesis_content.title: BTC Extreme RSI Reversal After News-Driven Spikes
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a sharp price spike (+8%+ in 4 hours) driven by positive news headlines (e.g., treasury buying, ETF inflows), followed by a 1-hour consolidation with declining volume, a mean reversion short entry will be profitable within the next 12 hours as speculative froth dissipates.
hypothesis_content.rationale: News-driven spikes in neutral/bull regimes often attract late retail FOMO, creating temporary overbought conditions. High RSI combined with volume divergence suggests exhaustion. The market frequently corrects these emotional moves before resuming trend.
entry_conditions: News sentiment score (headline-based) spikes to ≥ 0.8 (positive) within same 4-hour window
Following 1-hour candle closes with price within ±0.5% of previous close AND volume ≤ 70% of 4-hour spike volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price retraces 50% of the initial 4-hour spike move
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price exceeds the high of the 4-hour spike candle by 0.5%

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 55% of such setups lead to continuation (not reversal) over 12-hour window when tested on 2023-2024 data.
